intro: Navarretia vividior, commonly known as the vivid dwarf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, hairy leaves and has a short, upright stem. Navarretia vividior is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, where it blooms in the spring.
